instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-4924 "P" Key not working.
threads.message:
Where do I start with this? I already tried a different keyboard and confirmed the issue is on the Logic Board. Any help is very much appreciated. 

Keyboard connector looks perfect, no signs of liquid damage around it.

threads.title: 820-4924 "P" Key not working.
threads.message:
Impossible to have only one key not working because of MLB issue.
The keyboard matrix has more keys connected on every raw and column.
Check again all the keys, you should find other non working ones; maybe special functions.

threads.title: 820-4924 "P" Key not working.
threads.message: I'm realizing only keyboard keys w,y,u,s,x,n,m work, as far a letters go.

threads.title: 820-4924 "P" Key not working.
threads.message:
Depending how many keys don't work, the issue is located on a raw, or column.
Unfortunatelly no idea about the matrix layout.
Start checking continuity between J4813 and U4820/30.
Also check all the pull-up resistors R4850-62.

threads.title: 820-4924 "P" Key not working.
threads.message:
UPDATE******

Turned out the issue was U4820. Simply reflowed it with some fresh flux and it solved the issue. There must have been some liquid under it. Originally the Logic Board was liquid damaged but showed no liquid damage near the keyboard connector. Anyways all is working perfectly.

Case closed. 

Thank you much!!!!
